oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Comment on "Nuclear structure corrections in muonic deuterium"
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Miller, Gerald A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Physics - Atomic Physics
High Energy Physics - Phenomenology
Nuclear Experiment
Nuclear Theory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A recent letter [1] investigated the effects of deuteron polarizability in the mu D atom. The importance of understanding this atom has been heightened because of the possible light it could shed on the proton radius puzzle. Here we confirm, clarify, and emphasize the significance of the result [1] that the effects of the third Zemach moment are canceled by part of the deuteron polarizability effects. 1. K. Pachucki, Phys. Rev. Lett. 106, 193007 (2011)
Comment: 1 page, 0 figures This paper has been withdrawn due to a misinterpretation of published work
